functions.label: getKibanaRoleSchema
description:
Kibana specific portion of the role definition. It's represented as a list of base and/or
feature Kibana privileges. None of the entries should apply to the same spaces.
signature: <Readonly<{ base?: string[] | undefined; feature?: Record<string, string[]> | undefined; } & { spaces: string[] | "*"[]; }>[]>

signature: <Record<string, Readonly<{} & { kibana: Readonly<{ base?: string[] | undefined; feature?: Record<string, string[]> | undefined; } & { spaces: string[] | "*"[]; }>[]; elasticsearch: Readonly<{ cluster?: string[] | undefined; indices?: Readonly<{ query?: string | undefined; field_security?: Record<"except" | "grant", string[]> | undefined; allow_restricted_indices?: boolean | undefined; } & { names: string[]; privileges: string[]; }>[] | undefined; remote_cluster?: Readonly<{} & { privileges: string[]; clusters: string[]; }>[] | undefined; remote_indices?: Readonly<{ query?: string | undefined; field_security?: Record<"except" | "grant", string[]> | undefined; allow_restricted_indices?: boolean | undefined; } & { names: string[]; privileges: string[]; clusters: string[]; }>[] | undefined; run_as?: string[] | undefined; } & {}>; }>>>; }>

functions.label: getUpdateRestApiKeyWithKibanaPrivilegesSchema
signature: <Record<string, Readonly<{} & { kibana: Readonly<{ base?: string[] | undefined; feature?: Record<string, string[]> | undefined; } & { spaces: string[] | "*"[]; }>[]; elasticsearch: Readonly<{ cluster?: string[] | undefined; indices?: Readonly<{ query?: string | undefined; field_security?: Record<"except" | "grant", string[]> | undefined; allow_restricted_indices?: boolean | undefined; } & { names: string[]; privileges: string[]; }>[] | undefined; remote_cluster?: Readonly<{} & { privileges: string[]; clusters: string[]; }>[] | undefined; remote_indices?: Readonly<{ query?: string | undefined; field_security?: Record<"except" | "grant", string[]> | undefined; allow_restricted_indices?: boolean | undefined; } & { names: string[]; privileges: string[]; clusters: string[]; }>[] | undefined; run_as?: string[] | undefined; } & {}>; }>>>; }>

interfaces.label: Actions
description:
Actions are used to create the "actions" that are associated with Elasticsearch's
application privileges, and are used to perform the authorization checks implemented
by the various `checkPrivilegesWithRequest` derivatives.

children.label: get
signature: (ruleTypeId: string, consumer: string, alertingEntity: string, operation: string) => string

interfaces.label: APIKeys
description:
Interface for managing API keys in Elasticsearch, including creation,
validation, and invalidation of API keys,
as well as checking the status of API key features.

children.label: areAPIKeysEnabled
description: Determines if API Keys are enabled in Elasticsearch.

children.label: areCrossClusterAPIKeysEnabled
description: Determines if Cross-Cluster API Keys are enabled in Elasticsearch.

children.label: create
description:
Tries to create an API key for the current user.

Returns newly created API key or `null` if API keys are disabled.

User needs `manage_api_key` privilege to create REST API keys and `manage_security` for Cross-Cluster API keys.

children.label: request
description: Request instance.

children.label: createParams
description: The params to create an API key

children.label: update
description:
Attempts update an API key with the provided 'role_descriptors' and 'metadata'

Returns `updated`, `true` if the update was successful, `false` if there was nothing to update

User needs `manage_api_key` privilege to update REST API keys and `manage_security` for cross-cluster API keys.

children.label: request
description: Request instance.

children.label: updateParams
description: The params to edit an API key

children.label: grantAsInternalUser
description: Tries to grant an API key for the current user.

children.label: request
description: Request instance.

children.label: createParams
description: Create operation parameters.

children.label: validate
description: Tries to validate an API key.

children.label: apiKeyPrams
description: ValidateAPIKeyParams.

children.label: invalidate
description: Tries to invalidate an API keys.

children.label: request
description: Request instance.

children.label: params
description: The params to invalidate an API keys.

children.label: invalidateAsInternalUser
description: Tries to invalidate the API keys by using the internal user.

children.label: params
description: The params to invalidate the API keys.

Interface for managing API keys in Elasticsearch, including creation,

as well as checking the status of API key features.

Tries to create an API key for the current user.

Returns `updated`, `true` if the update was successful, `false` if there was nothing to update

User needs `manage_api_key` privilege to update REST API keys and `manage_security` for cross-cluster API keys.

interfaces.label: AuditEvent
description:
Audit event schema using ECS format: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/ecs/1.12/index.html

If you add additional fields to the schema ensure you update the Kibana Filebeat module:
https://github.com/elastic/beats/tree/master/filebeat/module/kibana

children.label: message
description: Log message

children.label: kibana
description: Kibana specific fields

children.label: http
description: Fields describing an HTTP request

interfaces.label: AuditHttp
description: Audit http schema using ECS format

children.label: request
description: HTTP request details

interfaces.label: AuditKibana
description: Audit kibana schema using ECS format

children.label: space_id
description: The ID of the space associated with this event.

children.label: session_id
description:
The ID of the user session associated with this event. Each login attempt
results in a unique session id.

children.label: saved_object
description: Saved object that was created, changed, deleted or accessed as part of this event.
signature: { type: string; id: string; name?: string | undefined; } | undefined

children.label: authentication_provider
description: Name of authentication provider associated with a login event.

children.label: authentication_type
description: Type of authentication provider associated with a login event.

children.label: authentication_realm
description: Name of Elasticsearch realm that has authenticated the user.

children.label: lookup_realm
description: Name of Elasticsearch realm where the user details were retrieved from.

children.label: add_to_spaces
description: Set of space IDs that a saved object was shared to.

children.label: delete_from_spaces
description: Set of space IDs that a saved object was removed from.

children.label: unauthorized_spaces
description: Set of space IDs that are not authorized for an action.

children.label: unauthorized_types
description: Set of types that are not authorized for an action.

children.label: log
description:
Logs an {@link AuditEvent} and automatically adds meta data about the
current user, space and correlation id.

Guidelines around what events should be logged and how they should be
structured can be found in: `/x-pack/plugins/security/README.md`

children.label: enabled
description:
Indicates whether audit logging is enabled or not.

Useful for skipping resource-intense operations that don't need to be performed when audit
logging is disabled.

interfaces.label: AuditRequest
description: Audit request schema using ECS format
signature: extends { body?: { bytes?: number | undefined; content?: string | undefined; } | undefined; bytes?: number | undefined; id?: string | undefined; method?: string | undefined; mime_type?: string | undefined; referrer?: string | undefined; }

children.label: headers
description: HTTP request headers

children.label: asScoped
description:
Creates an {@link AuditLogger} scoped to the current request.

This audit logger logs events with all required user and session info and should be used for
all user-initiated actions.

children.label: withoutRequest
description:
{@link AuditLogger} for background tasks only.

This audit logger logs events without any user or session info and should never be used to log
user-initiated actions.

interfaces.label: AuthenticationServiceStart
description: Authentication services available on the security plugin's start contract.

interfaces.label: AuthorizationServiceSetup
description: Authorization services available on the setup contract of the security plugin.

children.label: actions
description:
Actions are used to create the "actions" that are associated with Elasticsearch's
application privileges, and are used to perform the authorization checks implemented
by the various `checkPrivilegesWithRequest` derivatives.

interfaces.label: CheckPrivilegesOptions
description: Options to influce the privilege checks.

children.label: requireLoginAction
description:
Whether or not the `login` action should be required (default: true).
Setting this to false is not advised except for special circumstances, when you do not require
the request to belong to a user capable of logging into Kibana.

interfaces.label: CheckPrivilegesPayload
description: Privileges that can be checked for the Kibana users.

children.label: kibana
description: A list of the Kibana specific privileges (usually generated with `security.authz.actions.*.get(...)`).

children.label: elasticsearch
description: A set of the Elasticsearch cluster and index privileges.
signature: { cluster: string[]; index: Record<string, string[]>; } | undefined

children.label: privileges
signature: { kibana: { resource?: string | undefined; privilege: string; authorized: boolean; }[]; elasticsearch: { cluster: { privilege: string; authorized: boolean; }[]; index: { [indexName: string]: { privilege: string; authorized: boolean; }[]; }; }; }

interfaces.label: CheckUserProfilesPrivileges
description:
An interface to check users profiles privileges in a specific context (only a single-space context is supported at
the moment).

interfaces.label: CheckUserProfilesPrivilegesPayload
description: Privileges that can be checked for the users profiles (only Kibana specific privileges are supported at the moment).

children.label: kibana
description: A list of the Kibana specific privileges (usually generated with `security.authz.actions.*.get(...)`).

interfaces.label: CheckUserProfilesPrivilegesResponse
description: Response of the check privileges operation for the users profiles.

children.label: hasPrivilegeUids
description: The subset of the requested profile IDs of the users that have all the requested privileges.

children.label: errors
description:
An errors object that may be returned from ES that contains a `count` of UIDs that have errors in the `details` property.

Each entry in `details` will contain an error `type`, e.g 'resource_not_found_exception', and a `reason` message, e.g. 'profile document not found'
signature: { count: number; details: Record<string, { type: string; reason: string; }>; } | undefined

children.label: access
signature: { search?: { names: string[]; query?: unknown; field_security?: unknown; allow_restricted_indices?: boolean | undefined; }[] | undefined; replication?: { names: string[]; }[] | undefined; }

interfaces.label: ElasticsearchPrivilegesType
description: Type representing Elasticsearch specific portion of the role definition.

children.label: indices
signature: { names: string[]; field_security?: Record<"except" | "grant", string[]> | undefined; privileges: string[]; query?: string | undefined; allow_restricted_indices?: boolean | undefined; }[] | undefined

children.label: remote_indices
signature: { clusters: string[]; names: string[]; field_security?: Record<"except" | "grant", string[]> | undefined; privileges: string[]; query?: string | undefined; allow_restricted_indices?: boolean | undefined; }[] | undefined

children.label: id
description: Unique id for this API key

children.label: name
description: Name for this API key

children.label: api_key
description: Generated API key

interfaces.label: InvalidateAPIKeyResult
description: The return value when invalidating an API key in Elasticsearch.

children.label: invalidated_api_keys
description: The IDs of the API keys that were invalidated as part of the request.

children.label: previously_invalidated_api_keys
description: The IDs of the API keys that were already invalidated.

children.label: error_count
description: The number of errors that were encountered when invalidating the API keys.

children.label: error_details
description: Details about these errors. This field is not present in the response when error_count is 0.
signature: { type?: string | undefined; reason?: string | undefined; caused_by?: { type?: string | undefined; reason?: string | undefined; } | undefined; }[] | undefined

interfaces.label: InvalidateAPIKeysParams
description: Represents the params for invalidating multiple API keys

children.label: ids
description: List of unique API key IDs

interfaces.label: SecurityPluginSetup
description: Describes public Security plugin contract returned at the `setup` stage.

children.label: license
description: Exposes information about the available security features under the current license.

children.label: audit
description: Exposes services for audit logging.

children.label: privilegeDeprecationsService
description: Exposes services to access kibana roles per feature id with the GetDeprecationsContext

interfaces.label: SecurityPluginStart
description: Describes public Security plugin contract returned at the `start` stage.

children.label: authc
description: Authentication services to confirm the user is who they say they are.

children.label: authz
description: Authorization services to manage and access the permissions a particular user has.

children.label: userProfiles
description: User profiles services to retrieve user profiles.

children.label: access
signature: { search?: { names: string[]; query?: unknown; field_security?: unknown; allow_restricted_indices?: boolean | undefined; }[] | undefined; replication?: { names: string[]; }[] | undefined; }

interfaces.label: UserProfileBulkGetParams
description: Parameters for the bulk get API.

children.label: uids
description: List of user profile identifiers.

children.label: dataPath
description:
By default, suggest API returns user information, but does not return any user data. The optional "dataPath"
parameter can be used to return personal data for this user (within `kibana` namespace only).

interfaces.label: UserProfileGetCurrentParams
description: Parameters for the get user profile for the current user API.

children.label: request
description: User request instance to get user profile for.

children.label: dataPath
description:
By default, get API returns user information, but does not return any user data. The optional "dataPath"
parameter can be used to return personal data for this user (within `kibana` namespace only).

interfaces.label: UserProfileRequiredPrivileges
description: The set of privileges that users associated with the suggested user profile should have for a specified space id.

children.label: spaceId
description: The id of the Kibana Space.

children.label: privileges
description: The set of the Kibana specific application privileges.

interfaces.label: UserProfileSuggestParams
description: Parameters for the suggest API.

children.label: name
description:
Query string used to match name-related fields in user profiles. The following fields are treated as
name-related: username, full_name and email.

children.label: hint
description:
Extra search criteria to improve relevance of the suggestion result. A profile matching the
specified hint is ranked higher in the response. But not-matching the hint does not exclude a
profile from the response as long as it matches the `name` field query.

children.label: size
description: Desired number of suggestion to return. The default value is 10.

children.label: dataPath
description:
By default, suggest API returns user information, but does not return any user data. The optional "dataPath"
parameter can be used to return personal data for this user (within `kibana` namespace only).

children.label: requiredPrivileges
description:
The set of the privileges that users associated with the suggested user profile should have in the specified space.
If not specified, privileges check isn't performed and all matched profiles are returned irrespective to the
privileges of the associated users.

interfaces.label: ValidateAPIKeyParams
description: Represents the parameters for validating API Key credentials.

children.label: id
description: Unique id for this API key

children.label: api_key
description: Generated API Key (secret)
